page.title: 17FLOOD DITCH, CHRISTCHURCH.
page.content: OFF BARRACK ROAD THERE IS A BIG FIELD. PEOPLE WALK THEIR DOGS THERE. THE WORKMAN HAS JUST DUG A GREAT BIG FLOOD DITCH AS THERE IS A RIVER NEAR-BY. THE DITCH IS VERY DEEP AND PEOPLE ARE COMPLAINING THAT IT IS VERY DANGEROUS. THE PAPERS ARE ALSO COMPLAINING. THE DITCH IS USED AS A RUBBISH BIN AS IT IS FULL OF SWEET WRAPPERS AND CRISP PACKETS. THIS FLOOD DITCH HAS BEEN DUG ALL THE WAY ROUND THE FIELD AND IT TOOK NEARLY TWO WEEKS TO BUILD. NEAR-BY THEY ARE PUTTING IN HUGE STONE PIPES TO HELP STOP THE FLOODING. THE DITCH IS PARTLY FULL OF WATER. THERE HAS NOT BEEN A FLOOD FOR A LONG TIME. EVEN THOUGH THERE IS A BIG FLOOD DITCH RIGHT ROUND THE FIELD PEOPLE CAN STILL GET TO IT BECAUSE THEY HAVE BUILT A SMALL BRIDGE ACROSS THE DITCH.
